text: is a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Amano was born in Miura on July 19, 1991. After graduating from Juntendo University, he joined J1 League club Yokohama F. Marinos in 2014. He played many matches as offensive midfielder from 2017. In July 2019, he moved to Belgian First Division B club Lokeren Oost-Vlaanderen. Although he played many matches, the club was disbanded end of the 2019/20 season due to financial strain. In May 2020, he returned to Yokohama. On September 11, 2018, Amano debuted for the Japan national team against Costa Rica. ==Statistics== |- |2014||rowspan="6"|Yokohama F.
